      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void changeWaterFluid(net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid newWater)
      If this mod is used with other mods that use different types of water (fresh water, salt water etc), this can change which fluid EI considers water thus increasing compatibility.

      • changeWaterFluid

        public static void changeWaterFluid(net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid newWater)
        If this mod is used with other mods that use different types of water (fresh water, salt water etc), this can change which fluid EI considers water thus increasing compatibility.

      • getWaterFluid

        public static net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid getWaterFluid()

      • playerIsHoldingWaterContainer

        public static boolean playerIsHoldingWaterContainer(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        Check if the player is holding a water container.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        Whether the player is holding a container and it has water in it.

      • itemStackIsWaterContainer

        public static boolean itemStackIsWaterContainer(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack itemStack)
        Check if the ItemStack is a water container.
        Parameters:
        itemStack - The ItemStack.
        Returns:
        Whether the ItemStack is a container and has water in it.

      • getFluidFromItemStack

        private static net.minecraftforge.fluids.FluidStack getFluidFromItemStack(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack itemStack)
        Gets the FluidStack inside the ItemStack container.
        Parameters:
        itemStack - The ItemStack.
        Returns:
        The FluidStack in the ItemStack fluid container.

      • getFluidFromBlockState

        public static net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid getFluidFromBlockState(net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState state)
        Returns the Fluid for the given blockstate. Special handling for vanilla fluids (wooo >.>)
        Parameters:
        state - The blockstate
        Returns:
        The fluid. If the blockstate's material is WATER or LAVA, returns the according fluid from FluidRegistry. Can be null.

      • fillTankFromItem

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack fillTankFromItem(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack container,
                                                            net.minecraftforge.fluids.IFluidTank tank,
                                                            boolean drainContainer)
        Fills the IFluidTank with an ItemStack fluid container.
        Parameters:
        container - The ItemStack holding the fluid.
        tank - The tank to fill.
        drainContainer - Whether to actually drain the `container` ItemStack.
        Returns:
        The modified ItemStack, which probably has no fluid in it anymore.

      • getRoomLeftInTank

        private static int getRoomLeftInTank(net.minecraftforge.fluids.IFluidTank tank)
        Gets how much room there is in the tank for more fluids.
        Parameters:
        tank - The tank to check.
        Returns:
        How much space there is in the tank for more fluid.

      • getStillTexture

        public static net.minecraft.client.renderer.texture.TextureAtlasSprite getStillTexture(net.minecraft.client.Minecraft mc,
                                                                                       net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid fluid)
        Gets the still texture for the fluid
        Parameters:
        mc - Minecraft instance
        fluid - Fluid to get the texture of
        Returns:
        the texture

      • getStillFluidLevel

        public static int getStillFluidLevel(net.minecraft.block.Block block)
        Returns the "level" value for the block that is considered the still fluid block.
        Parameters:
        block - The block
        Returns:
        If the block is a BlockFluidBase (Forge fluid), the max render height meta, otherwise 0.

      • getFluidLevel

        public static int getFluidLevel(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos)
        Gets the current fluid level for the block. Handles Forge and Minecraft fluids differently >.>
        Parameters:
        world - The world
        pos - The pos
        Returns:
        The current level

      • isInfiniteWaterSource

        public static boolean isInfiniteWaterSource(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                            net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                            net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid fluid)
        Checks whether the block is an infinite source block of water.
        Parameters:
        world - The world
        pos - The block that is being tested against
        fluid - The fluid in the block
        Returns:
        Whether the given pos can be treated as an infinite source of water. For example, if the water is "XYZ", only "Y" will return true.

      • findSourceBlockPos

        public static net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos findSourceBlockPos(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                                                  net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos start,
                                                                  net.minecraftforge.fluids.Fluid fluid,
                                                                  java.util.Set<net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos> alreadyChecked)
        Recursively scans the blocks around the given starting block to check if they are fluids.
        Parameters:
        world - The world
        start - The block to start scanning at. It will check all directions adjacent to it except down.
        fluid - The fluid in the block
        alreadyChecked - The list of blocks that have already been checked.
        Returns:
        The BlockPos that is a source block. If none is found, returns null.

      • getFluidHandler

        public static net.minecraftforge.fluids.capability.IFluidHandler getFluidHandler(net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity tile,
                                                                                 net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing dir)
        TODO: Deprecate and use FluidUtil.getFluidHandler(World, BlockPos, EnumFacing) instead.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile (nonnull)
        dir - The direction (can be null)
        Returns:
        An IFluidHandler for the Tile and direction. If it uses the deprecated API, returns a new wrapper.
